wikipedia_page.main: Margaret Haig Mackworth (née Thomas), 2nd Viscountess Rhondda (12 June 1883 – 20 July 1958) was a Welsh peeress, businesswoman and active suffragette who was significant in the history of women's suffrage in the United Kingdom.

response: *Margaret Haig Thomas, 2nd Viscountess Rhondda was cleared to become the first female member of the House of Lords in the United Kingdom, after the Committee for Privileges and Conduct agreed with her argument that she was entitled under the law to succeed to the peerage of her father, David Alfred Thomas, 1st Viscount Rhondda, who had died in 1918."Peeress Admitted to House of Lords; Decision Gives Seat to Lady Rhondda Opens the Way to a Score of Others", The New York Times, March 3, 1922, p.1
*Margaret Haig Thomas, 2nd Viscountess Rhondda (1883–1958), Welsh noblewoman, businesswoman, and suffragette
